intro: Cousinia kopi-karadaghensis, commonly known as the Kopi-Karadagh gentian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Cousinia kopi-karadaghensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
